text: It is said the Flame-Mother is a creation of Hekarti, dwelling between the mortal realm and the Realm of Chaos. She rarely enters the world—perhaps once a century—emerging through the blazing heart of a volcano.
Now the Flame-Mother has answered your call, descending into the mortal world. With ever-burning phoenix wings, she shall reduce all things to ash.
The Bloodhorn Abomination answers your call—every twisted limb hungers for the battlefield’s feast of flesh.
The lord of the Hellpit has accepted a rich contract from Clan Gritus—thus, the Bloodhorn Abomination has descended upon the world.
This one-eyed giant is larger, stronger, and faster than any other Beastman. Even Bray-Shamans fear him—for he can silence magic itself.
Thesmund the Soul-Eater has answered your call. He has found his kin and convinced them to join your warpath.
Mad Titan Broga dwells deep in the Grey Mountains, inside a fungus cave just big enough for him. He allows no creature—living or dead—to trespass on his domain.
Mad Titan Broga is a brutish and arrogant giant, normally idle. Now he has heeded your call and is ready to smash his way across the land.
Rumors speak of a beast named Gench lurking in northern Naggarond, preying on lone Dark Elves and stray wanderers. But what happens when someone dares to invade its hunting grounds?
The beast Leymah has answered your call—ready to turn the entire Warhammer world into her personal hunting ground.
Traggard the Mountainbreaker is a thousand-year-old ancient Dragon Ogre. His only thought is to annihilate mankind with deadly lightning storms.
Traggard the Mountainbreaker has answered your call—ready to unleash destruction and slaughter across the world.
In myth, the Abyssal Screecher is feared for its soul-shattering wail and eyes like voids—devouring all magic and light.
The Abyssal Screecher, once a tale of terror, now answers your call—prepared to spread fear across the entire world.
There exists a Carnosaur without equal. The Lizardmen call it "Kagantuzan"—the Beast of the Old Ones—and venerate it as a lesser deity.
This greatest of wild Carnosaurs has roamed Lustria for centuries. But now, the dwindling rainforest no longer feeds its hunger—and it has answered your call.
Among the northern tribes, tales speak of Frigost, the Frozen Voidspawn—a massive frost wyrm that has lurked in the tundra for centuries.
Now, Frigost the Frozen Voidspawn answers your call. Wherever it treads, blizzards rise—its freezing breath threatens to engulf the world.
In Karak Ironpeak lives the Broodmother—Arachna'rei, the Spider Queen. This venomous beast feasts daily on Orcs, Goblins, and any fool who wanders too close.
The venomous Spider Queen has been tamed. Use her power wisely.
